translation: How marvelous is the Buddha, how marvelous is Dharma, and how marvelous is the saṃgha.
Marvelous is the power of the most excellent dhāraṇī mudrā.
It's able to remove all suffering and distress.
It causes me to be freed from such bad actions.
When the well-abiding gods saw this, they said.

source_sentence: 即便往詣彼天帝所作如是言。
translation: He then went to the god Indra's place and said.
I've been blessed by the gods to invite the Buddha for my sake.
The Buddha taught me the great dhāraṇī.
It causes all of my bad actions to be completely removed.
I want to go and thank the Bhagavān for his kindness.
May the king of gods go with me.
At the time, Śakra led his followers.

source_sentence: 與善住俱持諸香花眾妙瓔珞。
translation: He's accompanied by the well-abiding, carrying a multitude of fragrant flowers and marvelous jewelry.
He rode the heavenly jeweled carriage to the Buddha's place.
They make offerings to the Tathāgata with various offerings.
He circled it a hundred thousand times and stood to one side.
They sing praises of the Buddha's virtue, but they can't proclaim it.
It was then that the Bhagavān extended his golden hand.

source_sentence: 撫彼善住發和雅音授其記莂。
translation: He strokes their well-abiding and produces a harmonious voice to give them assurance of future enlightenment.
The well-abiding gods then rejoiced and withdrew.
He listens to the essentials of the Tathāgata's teaching.
After hearing the Dharma preached, his mind leaps and dances with joy.
They bowed to the Buddha together with Indra and withdrew.
Foding zuisheng tuoluoni jing
Dhāraṇī of the Great Wheel-Turning Vajra
